global_attributes.title: SWOT discharge prior information and processing outputs
global_attributes.summary: All of the outputs from all processes used to generate SWOT discharge products.
global_attributes.keywords_vocabulary: NASA Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Science Keywords
global_attributes.acknowledgement: NASA AIST Program Grant Number 80NSSC22K1487, NASA SWOT Science Team Grant Numbers: 80NSSC20K1143, 80NSSC20K1141, 80NSSC20K1340 and CNES SWOT TOSCA fund for the SWOT DAHM project. Additional support from PO.DAAC and the SWOT mission.
global_attributes.references: Confluence codebase: https://github.com/SWOT-Confluence; A Framework for Estimating Global River Discharge From the Surface Water and Ocean Topography Satellite Mission: https://doi.org/10.1029/2021WR031614
global_attributes.institution: NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) Physical Oceanography Distributed Active Archive Center (PO.DAAC)/University of Massachusetts Amherst (UMass)/Ohio State University
global_attributes.project: Surface Water And Ocean Topography Discharge Algorithms Working Group (SWOT DAWG)
global_attributes.license: Issued under Creative Commons CC BY 4.0: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

A0.comment: Part of the flow area that is below the lowest observation

beta.long_name: exponent for the Strickler power law
beta.comment: Exponent of the Strickler law : K=alpha*h**beta

alpha.long_name: coefficient for the Strickler power law
alpha.comment: Coefficient of the Strickler law : K=alpha*h**beta

allq.comment: discharge of all times, including those outside inversion window

A0hat.comment: represented as the cross-sectional area of the initial time in the timeseries

nahat.comment: coefficient of the manning's equation power law

x1hat.comment: exponent for the manning coefficient power law

q_u.comment: uncertainty calculated as the standard deviation of the Markov Chain

q.comment: timeseries of discharge for each swot overpass for geoBAM

a0.long_name: back-calculated A0 to match SWOT discharge philosophy
a0.comment: represented as the cross-sectional area at the time of the median WSE in the timeseries

n.long_name: temporally constant Manning's n for neoBAM

qbar_reachScale.long_name: average discharge computed in stage 1 (reach scale)
qbar_reachScale.comment: timeseries average of discharge estimated from reach scale (stage 1) FLPE

qbar_basinScale.long_name: average discharge computed in stage 2 (basin scale)
qbar_basinScale.comment: Stage 2 algorithm requires average flows to be positive

q.comment: timeseries of discharge for each swot overpass for MetroMan

Abar.comment: represented as the cross-sectional area at the time of the median WSE in the timeseries

alpha.long_name: coefficient for the Strickler power law
alpha.comment: Coefficient of the Strickler law : K=alpha*h**beta

beta.long_name: exponent for the Strickler power law
beta.comment: Exponent of the Strickler law : K=alpha*h**beta

qbar_reachScale.long_name: time average of the reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates
qbar_reachScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates

qbar_basinScale.long_name: time average of the basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates
qbar_basinScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates

q.comment: timeseries of discharge for each swot overpass for MetroMan

Abar.comment: represented as the cross-sectional area at the time of the median WSE in the timeseries

na.comment: coefficient of the manning's equation power law

x1.comment: exponent for the manning coefficient power law

qbar_reachScale.comment: timeseries average of discharge estimated from reach scale (stage 1) FLPE

qbar_basinScale.comment: Stage 2 algorithm requires average flows to be positive

B.comment: bottom of the river elevation calculated in stage 2 algorithms

H.comment: bank height elevation calculated in stage 2 algorithms

Save.comment: average of the slope measurements from SWOT

qbar_reachScale.long_name: time average of the reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates
qbar_reachScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates

qbar_basinScale.long_name: time average of the basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates
qbar_basinScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates

qbar_reachScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates

qbar_basinScale.long_name: time average of the basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates
qbar_basinScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates

n.comment: Manning's roughness coefficient constant in time

qbar_reachScale.long_name: time average of the reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates
qbar_reachScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  reach scale (stage 1) discharge estimates

qbar_basinScale.long_name: time average of the basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates
qbar_basinScale.comment: average of the timeseries of the  basin scale (stage 2) discharge estimates

node_id.comment:
Taken from SWORD PDD: id of each node the high resolution centerline point is associated with. The format of the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRNNNT where
C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin codes up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream), N = Node id (assigned sequentially within a reach starting at the downstream end working upstream), T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost node)

reach_id.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD: id of the reach each node is associated with. The format of the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRT where C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin codes up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream), T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost reach)d

time.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD: Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the metadata leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.

observations.comment: Pass numbers associated with observations for each node. Cycle passes are taken from shapefile name where a single cycle, pass combination is separated by an underscored (e.g., 112_386 representing cycle 112 and pass 386). Cycle, pass combinations are stored as strings with each cycle_pass element separated by a comma for each node that has observations.

x.comment: longitude of each node ranging from 180°E to 180°W

y.comment: latitude of each node ranging from 90°S to 90°N

river_name.comment: all river names associated with a node. If there are multiple names for a node they are listed in alphabetical order and separated by a semicolon.

d_x_area_u.long_name: total uncertainty of the change in the cross-sectional area
d_x_area_u.comment: total uncertainty of the change in the cross-sectional area

realism_flags.comment: flag to check if flows are realistic

prepost_flags.comment: flag to check if the flows are wildly different between priors and posteriors

stability_flags.comment: flag to check if the flows are wildly different from one Confluence run to the next

realism_flags.comment: flag to check if flows are realistic

stability_flags.comment: flag to check if the flows are wildly different from one Confluence run to the next

ice_clim_f.comment: Application of the climatological ice cover SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

ice_dyn_f.comment: Application of the dynamic ice cover SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

dark_frac.comment: Application of the fraction of reach area_total covered by dark water SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

obs_frac_n.comment: Application of the fraction of nodes SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

reach_q.comment: Application of the summary quality indicator for the reach measurement SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

xovr_cal_q.comment: Application of quality of the cross-over calibration SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed reach was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed reach was not overwritten.

low_slope_flag.comment: Low slope flag indicator for slope and slope2 observations.

d_x_area_flag.comment: Indicates if d_x_area flag was overwritten with missing value because width or wse was not observed.

ice_clim_f.comment: Application of the climatological ice cover SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed node was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed node was not overwritten.

ice_dyn_f.comment: Application of the dynamic ice cover SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed node was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed node was not overwritten.

dark_frac.comment: Application of the fraction of node area_total covered by dark water SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed node was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed node was not overwritten.

node_q.comment: Application of the summary quality indicator for the node measurement SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed node was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed node was not overwritten.

xovr_cal_q.comment: Application of quality of the cross-over calibration SWOT flag. A value of 1 indicates the indexed node was overwritten and a value of 0 indicates the indexed node was not overwritten.

low_slope_flag.comment: Low slope flag indicator for slope and slope2 observations.

d_x_area_flag.comment: Indicates if d_x_area flag was overwritten with missing value because width or wse was not observed.

probability.comment: GRADES probability values from the flow duration curve for this cell

flow_duration_q.comment: GRADES discharge values from the flow duration curve for this cell

max_q.comment: GRADES highest discharge value in this cell

monthly_q.comment: GRADES monthly mean discharge time series in this cell

mean_q.comment: GRADES mean discharge value in this cell

min_q.comment: GRADES lowest discharge value in this cell

two_year_return_q.comment: GRADES two year return interval discharge value in this cell

area_estimate_flag.comment: This cell was not a good match. Data has been scaled by difference in flow accumulation area.

comid.comment: ID in the MERIT Hydro system

overwritten_indexes.comment: Indexes of GRADES priors that were overwritten by priors module.

overwritten_source.comment: Source of gauge data that overwrote GRADES priors.

bad_priors.comment: Indexes of invalid gauge priors that were not overwritten.

reach_id.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD: id of each reach. The format of none the id is as follows: CBBBBBRRRRT where C = Continent (the first number of the Pfafstetter basin code), B = Remaining Pfafstetter basin codes up to level 6, R = Reach id (assigned sequentially within a level 6 basin starting at the downstream end working upstream, T = Type (1 – river, 3 – lake on river, 4 – dam or waterfall, 5 – unreliable topology, 6 – ghost reach)

time.comment: Taken from SWORD PDD: Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the metadata leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.

observations.comment: Pass numbers associated with observations for each reach. Cycle passes are taken from shapefile name where a single cycle, pass combination is separated by an underscored (e.g., 112_386 representing cycle 112 and pass 386). Cycle, pass combinations are stored as strings with each cycle_pass element separated by a comma for each reach that has observations.

x.comment: longitude of the reach center decimal ranging from 180°E to 180°W

y.comment: latitude of the reach center decimal ranging from 90°S to 90°N

river_name.comment: all river names associated with a reach. If there are multiple names for a reach they are listed in alphabetical order and separated by a semicolon.

n.comment: Manning's roughness coefficient constant in time

Q_da.comment: Discharge time series at node or reach level with improved observations output of Bayesian data assimilation

Q_mm.long_name: Computed discharge using optimization of modified Manning's equation
Q_mm.comment: Discharge time series at reach level using SWOT reach observations output of optimization of modified Manning's equation

elevation.comment: Bed levels at each cross-section (dry observed bathymetry and wet estimated bathymetry)

width.comment: Bed widths at each cross-section (dry observed bathymetry and wet estimated bathymetry)

Q_u.comment: Discharge standard deviation (posterior distribution estimated by data assimilation)

algo_names.comment: The names of algorithms that have been validated

has_validation.comment: Whether the reach has validation data.

testn.comment: number of datapoints used for statistical test

nrmse.comment: root mean squared error normalized by mean gauge discharge

nbias.comment: bias normalized by mean gauge discharge

gageid.comment: agency identification code for in situ gage

spearmanr.comment: Spearman correlation coefficient between estimated and measured in situ discharge

sige.comment: standard deviation of the unnormalized discharge error, divided by the mean flow

width.comment: Reach surface water area divided by the reach length

slope.comment: Upstream and downstream water-surface elevations divided by the reach length

Qgage.long_name: Ground-gaged streamflow obs contemporaneous with SWOT obs
Qgage.comment: The ground gage is an independent discharge measuring point within the reach obtained from an existing streamgage network

seg.long_name: A portion of the stage-width curve (relation)
seg.comment: seg = 1, below bankfull stage; seg = 2, equal to or above bankfull stage

n.long_name: Manning flow resistance estimated for the reach
n.comment: Represents the resistance to flow within the reach when using the Manning equation to describe the mean flow

Y.long_name: Average water depth within the reach
Y.comment: Mean depth of flow in the reach excluding zones of zero flow and is not directly measured

v.long_name: Average velocity of flow within the reach
v.comment: Computed from the mean depth, slope, and flow resistance; not measured

Q.comment: For cases with complete SWOT-observed data (slope, width, elevation)

Q_constrained.long_name: MOMMA-estimated discharges using Qgage values for calibration
Q_constrained.comment: For cases when Qgage values are available and gage_constrained == TRUE

gage_constrained.long_name: Boolean indicating presence of Qgage obs available for calibration
gage_constrained.comment: Set to TRUE if Qgage values are available for calibration

input_Qm_prior.long_name: Prior estimated mean daily discharge for the reach
input_Qm_prior.comment: Prior calibration target contained and hosted in the SWORD database

input_Qb_prior.long_name: Prior estimated bankfull discharge for the reach
input_Qb_prior.comment: Prior calibration target contained and hosted in the SWORD database

input_Yb_prior.long_name: Prior estimated bankfull depth for the reach
input_Yb_prior.comment: Prior calibration target contained and hosted in the SWORD database

input_known_ezf.long_name: Prior elevation of zero flow (channel thalweg stage)
input_known_ezf.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the bottom elevation of the reach channel relative to stage datum

input_known_bkfl_stage.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the bankfull stage of the reach channel relative to stage datum

input_known_nb_seg1.long_name: Prior reach-average flow resistance for stages below bankfull
input_known_nb_seg1.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the base n-value below bankfull

input_known_x_seg1.long_name: Prior reach-average flow resistance exponent for stages below bankfull
input_known_x_seg1.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the resistance exponent below bankfull

Qgage_constrained_nb_seg1.long_name: Reach-average flow resistance for stages below bankfull derived from calibration with Qgage data

Qgage_constrained_x_seg1.long_name: Reach-average flow resistance exponent for stages below bankfull derived from calibration with Qgage data

input_known_nb_seg2.long_name: Prior reach-average flow resistance for stages above bankfull
input_known_nb_seg2.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the base n-value above bankfull

input_known_x_seg2.long_name: Prior reach-average flow resistance exponent for stages above bankfull
input_known_x_seg2.comment: If known, a provided (prior) value of the resistance exponent above bankfull

Qgage_constrained_nb_seg2.long_name: Reach-average flow resistance for stages above bankfull derived from calibration with Qgage data

Qgage_constrained_x_seg2.long_name: Reach-average flow resistance exponent for stages above bankfull derived from calibration with Qgage data

n_bkfl_Qb_prior.long_name: Reach-average flow resistance at bankfull stage
n_bkfl_Qb_prior.comment: Computed if input_Qb_prior is available (not NA)

n_bkfl_slope.long_name: Empirically estimated reach-average flow resistance at bankfull stage
n_bkfl_slope.comment: Estimated using the mean of all slope values from SWOT observations in the Bray and Davar equation https://il.water.usgs.gov/proj/nvalues/equations.shtml?equation=09-bray1

vel_bkfl_Qb_prior.long_name: Reach-average discharge velocity at bankfull stage
vel_bkfl_Qb_prior.comment: Computed if input_Qb_prior is available (not NA)

Froude_bkfl_diag_Smean.long_name: Bankfull Froude number derived from mean slope
Froude_bkfl_diag_Smean.comment: The value for the diagnostic Froude number is computed from equation (9) found in Bjerklie et al., 2018 (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jhydrol.2018.04.005)

width_bkfl_solved_obs.long_name: Estimated bankfull width found from SWOT observations associated with the observed  bankfull stage
width_bkfl_solved_obs.comment: the computed bankfull width may not be the highest value in the record if an overbank segment is identified or if it is not associated with the identified bankfull stage

depth_bkfl_solved_obs.long_name: The estimated mean bankfull depth calculated assuming a parabolic channel shape
depth_bkfl_solved_obs.comment: the relation between the stage and width squared is used to define a parabolic channel cross-section shape defining the bottom stage for the channel. Alternative cross-section geometry assumptions are possible.

depth_bkfl_diag_Wb_Smean.long_name: Estimated bankfull depth based on the bankfull width and mean SWOT-observed slope
depth_bkfl_diag_Wb_Smean.comment: the value for the diagnostic bankfull depth is computed from equation (20) found in Bjerklie 2007 (https://doi:10.1016/j.jhydrol.2007.04.011);  is used as a diagnostic comparison with MOMMA estimated bankfull depth

zero_flow_stage.long_name: MOMMA-estimated elevation of zero flow (channel thalweg stage)
zero_flow_stage.comment: The zero flow stage (elevation of zero flow) is the stage below which the algorithm would return zero discharge, and serves as the stage defining the reach averaged bottom elevation from which mean depth of flow is referenced

bankfull_stage.comment: The bankfull stage is used to reference an in-bank and overbank segment (if this exists in the observational record) and is used to derive relative depths for calculation of the flow resistance in the algorithm.

Qmean_prior.long_name: Prior estimated mean daily discharge for the reach
Qmean_prior.comment: Prior calibration target contained and hosted in the SWORD database; same as input_Qm_prior

Qmean_momma.comment: Mean of all discharge estimates for each SWOT observation

Qmean_momma.constrained.long_name: MOMMA-estimated mean discharge derived from calibration with Qgage data
